Key Arguments: Australia cannot create its own commonwealth as it is part of the Commonwealth of Great Britain.
The royal prerogative to deny assent was removed in 1688, making any subsequent constitutions illegitimate.
The Magna Carta 1215 is the true democratic common law constitution, recognizing the people as the supreme judiciary and legislature.
The 1901 Australian Constitution is viewed as a dictatorship, as it allows the government to judge its own legislation.
Australia was set up as a for-profit outdoor prison, with crime and prisons as major revenue sources.
The concept of democracy is misunderstood, as it should mean people rule, not just vote.
Government can become criminal by being influenced by private interests, and mechanisms to prevent this were removed in 1688.
Main Themes: Criticism of government power and structure
Notable Quotes: The Magna Carta 1215 is a democratic common law constitution that recognizes the people as the supreme judiciary and legislature.
The 1901 is the antithesis of democracy and it's time for Australians to mature by understanding the sins of the past so they can stop repeating them.
